company.name: The Receivable Management Services Corporation
company.business_description: The Receivable Management Services Corporation is a collection agency.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: The Receivable Management Services Corporation, a debt collection agency, falsely claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework from February 2010 until November 2013. The company had initially self-certified to the Safe Harbor in February 2009 but failed to renew its certification in February 2010, causing its status to change to 'not current.' Despite this lapse, the company continued to display the Safe Harbor certification mark and claim adherence to Safe Harbor principles on its website for nearly four years.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be registered with and adhere to the U.S. Safe Harbor program and principles
representations_made.quoted_text: RMS is registered with the U.S. Department of Commerce's Safe Harbor program, and adheres to the U.S. Safe Harbor principles of Notice, Choice, Onward Transfer, Security, Data Integrity, Access, and Enforcement as defined by the agency…

representations_made.description: Displayed the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework Certification Mark on its website
representations_made.quoted_text: From at least February 2009 until November 2013, respondent displayed the mark on the www.rmsna.com website.

representations_made.description: Represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: Through the means described in Paragraphs 12 and 13, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claim
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework through statements on its website claiming registration and adherence to Safe Harbor principles and by displaying the Safe Harbor certification mark
counts.fact: From February 2010 until November 2013, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework, having failed to renew its self-certification in February 2010
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representations set forth in Paragraph 14 are false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: The Receivable Management Services Corporation and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Program Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in privacy or security programs including Safe Harbor Frameworks
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents relating to compliance with this order, including advertisements, promotional materials, and documents that question compliance.

requirements.description: Maintain all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by the order for five years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel within 30 days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within 30 days after they assume relevant positions or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities

requirements.description: Deliver order at least 10 days prior to any change in business structure
requirements.quoted_text: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure.

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated acknowledgment statements from all recipients within 30 days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to corporate changes affecting compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If learning of corporate changes fewer than 30 days before they occur, notify the Commission as soon as practicable
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days after service of the order and submit additional reports within 10 days of written notice from the Commission.

requirements.description: File initial compliance report within 60 days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order.

requirements.description: Submit additional compliance reports within 10 days of written notice from the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or 20 years from the most recent date that the U.S. or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on June 19, 2034, or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint filing date, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Part in this order that terminates in fewer than twenty (20) years; B. this order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Part. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that respondent did not violate any provision of the order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the order as to such respondent will terminate according to this Part as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later

source_files.complaint: 06.14, Receivable Management Services Corporation, The Complaint.pdf
source_files.order: 06.14, Receivable Management Services Corporation, The Order.pdf
